content.title: Silicosis Rehabilitation Pension- Haryana Silicosis Board
content.details: The scheme 'Silicosis Rehabilitation Pension' is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹4,000/- is given to the Silicosis-affected worker categorized as category (A, B, or C) according to the ILO Classification, until he/she remains alive. Only workers who are confirmed to be suffering from Silicosis by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, will be eligible for the assistance.
benefits: Monthly pension of ₹4,000/- for Silicosis-affected workers categorized as category (A, B, or C) according to the ILO Classification.
eligibility: Only workers who are confirmed to be suffering from Silicosis by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, will be eligible for the assistance.
The Silicosis-affected worker should be categorized as either category A, B, or C according to the ILO Classification.
The worker should have been registered with the Haryana Silicosis Board.
The worker should have been employed in a factory or at a construction site.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. Applicants may visit the nearest Labour Office to collect the application form or download it from the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana.
documents_required: Medical Report (X-Ray, CT Scan, Medical Prescription, Any Other)
General Document ( ESI Card, Any Other)

faqs.question: Who implements this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the pension under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Only workers confirmed to be suffering from Silicosis by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, and categorized as category (A, B, or C) according to the ILO Classification are eligible.

faqs.question: How much is the monthly pension provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a monthly pension of ₹4,000/-.

faqs.question: What is Silicosis?
faqs.answer: Silicosis is an incurable lung disease caused by inhaling silica dust, common in workplaces like stone crushers and mines.

faqs.question: What are the symptoms of Silicosis?
faqs.answer: Symptoms include shortness of breath, fatigue, loss of appetite, chest pain, dry cough, respiratory failure, and it eventually leads to death.

faqs.question: Who confirms the diagnosis of Silicosis?
faqs.answer: The diagnosis is confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana.

faqs.question: How is the category of a Silicosis-affected worker determined?
faqs.answer: The category (A, B, or C) is determined according to the ILO Classification by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board.

faqs.question: How can eligible workers apply for the pension benefits?
faqs.answer: Eligible workers may visit the nearest Antyodaya Kendra or Labour Office and fill up the application form.
